page.title: 11HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Valewood Farm House is no longer a farm, the majority of the land being sold off in 1983 to Lord Wise. The house is a timber framed hall house, dating back to Elizabethan times.In the garden are seven springs which form the head waters of the River Wey. Valewood House was built in the seventeenth century. In 1830 an Irish man called Logan turned the building into a mansion, with pleasure gardens. The grounds occupy ten and a half acres, with a lake covering five and a half acres.Half an acre has been used to make a secret garden. Among other well known owners was James Mangles, the diarist. The house is now used as a Nursing Home. Lowder Mill was powered by water gained from artificial ponds. It is an 18th century building of stone and brick. It is now a private residence.
